storyInfo: In the wilderness of the Siracusan midwest, three young men, freshly escaped from the city and driving a stolen car, embark on a new journey.

attributes.content: On the endless barrens, a red-haired Vulpo man squats on the ground, concentrating hard on something.
Not far behind him is a car, undergoing inspection from a Lupo with white hair and a Feline in black.
The three of them seem like companions, and their ride, broken down.
Hey, Aosta, come over here.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Look at these bugs.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: See what they're doing? All walking in a line.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: And their group's pretty long too. Let me see where they're heading.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Looks like you're charged back up.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Yeah, I'm feeling a lot better now!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: I don't put too much stock in your own self-reports, though.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: What are you, my mamma?!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: You were coughing blood half an hour ago.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Ha ha, but I'm not now.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Ah, shit. I spent too long talking to you and now the bugs are gone.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Forget it. I'm going back to fix the car again.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Hey, have you guys figured out what's wrong with the car yet? Want me to come help?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: The tubing's busted in places. The engine won't start.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Me and Broca can deal with it. Just stay in one place, okay.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Not like I've got anywhere to go. There's nothing out here, and nowhere to run to.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Following a rumble, the engine comes to life again.
Phew... Broca, go and call Chiave back here.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Yo, Broca, why don't we see who can piss farther!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: My bladder is empty.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: You don't give him straight answers to these, Broca.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Damn, that's a shame! This is perfect weather to piss to!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Aside from polar wastes, I don't think there's any weather bad for p... for relieving yourself.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: You just don't get it, Aosta. It's all about a feeling!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Ah, a perfect arc—che cazzo!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: The wind just blew my perfect arc onto my shoes! Tch, what a bummer.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Just leave it, we're gonna go. If we can't find a rendezvous before sundown, we'll have to sleep out on the barrens tonight.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: What's wrong with the barrens?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Look at it this way, I've never been camping before! Let's camp out today!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: The barrens are a death trap, and realistically speaking, this jacked ride doesn't even have any camping equipment in it. Our only place to sleep is inside.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Also, fuel is another problem.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Cheh. The last owner just didn't get it.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: I don't think the average city car owner would have any camping stuff prepared, let alone additional fuel.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Who knows if one day someone'll borrow your car to go camping, eh? It doesn't hurt to prepare!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: And would you?
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Eh... no.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Then shut up and get ready to leave.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Aight.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Are we off now?
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Mm-hm. Let me drive.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Whaaat? Isn't it my turn?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: You just relax.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Aosta, you know something? You get more and more like a mamma every day.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Hey, Broca, you get where I'm coming from?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: A little.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: It's because both of you have Oripathy.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: I hear good life habits help keep illness in check. You should go to bed earlier every day, Chiave.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: God, y'know, Aosta? My own mamma never told me that.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Sticazzi... just shut up.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Aosta says as he starts the engine.
What's some good tunes to put on...
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: *Clicks tongue* Respect to the owner, they listened to a lot... Ah-ha, I like the look of this sleeve. Put this on!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Chiave inserts his newfound record disc into the car's hi-fi system, and lively music bursts from the speakers—
'♪Saturday's coming, wanna ride my beast far'
'♪To your apartment with a present like a star'
(Whistle) Not bad.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: For sure. Okay, on we go.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: By the way, Aosta.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Mm?
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Where are we heading right now?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: I should've answered this before we set off.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: I forgot.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: I bet you weren't even listening in the first place.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: I nabbed a map while were slipping out. For now, we're heading towards Locomotiva City, since it's closest.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: They've taken a rocky road with our family. As long as we're lucky, we can join up with them.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: If not, at least we have somewhere to stop over.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Hey, I used to hear about this weird village in the west of Siracusa. It was all haunted inside. Let's go take a look.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Keep dreaming. We don't even know where it is. You don't even know if someone just made that up.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Then how about we go see a city one of the other Twelve Families runs?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Hey, y'know, the Sicilia Legale counts as one of the Thirteen Families, but they fight each other plenty. Some alliance, hah!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: The Sicilia Legale don't organize like all the actual Families. After all, it's made up of tons of families, big and small.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Nobody from the big Families would give a shit about our Sicilia Legale nobodies.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Pff. They'll come begging for me to join them one day, no doubt about it.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: In any case, there's no heading back to Vite City for now... no, maybe we can never return.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: And we've offended the Trin Famiglia. We've got no place in Vite anymore.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Ha ha. We caused a shitstorm, after all. I kinda wanna see my old capo Layton. *Hack*—*spit*! See what his stupid face looks like right now.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: For sure.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Ha. Too late for regrets at this point.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Regrets... I wouldn't go that far. Layton was a real son of a bitch, after all.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Sold us out and still wanted us to count his money. Wasn't happening.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Mm-hm. No regrets here either.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Hey, take your mind off it. Look, there's still some families who treat coming out of jail for the first time like an initiation, and you're not a real member until then.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: And yesterday, we defied our Family and hightailed it out of the city.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: So I now declare, you are true members of my Chiave Famiglia!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Aosta, you're the family's consigliere!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Haha.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Broca, you're the family's underboss!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: '♪But when you smile at the ground it ain't hard to tell—'
'♪You don't know—'
'♪You don't know you're disgusting!'
By the way, we've been driving for ages without seeing a single guy, eh.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Apart from a couple gathering spots and settlements, there wouldn't be any lone travelers outside the cities in the first place.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Because there's a few families who couldn't stick it in the cities and spread out to the barrens to wreck shop. I've been with the family's caravans a few times before, and every time we'd make the right preparations.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Anyone like us, running off into the wild without a second of prep? Probably cruising down Death Road.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Ha, Death Road. I like that.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: But yeah, back in the garage, I saw plenty of guys prepping themselves a hell of a lot of stuff to head out with.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Egh, if we coulda brought a little more to eat when we escaped, that woulda been good. Aosta—
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Forget about the food in the trunk. That's for emergencies.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Tch.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: I'll take the fact we escaped at all.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: If we weren't lucky enough to have Mandel on guard that night, we'd probably be tied to chairs blindfolded in a dark closet right about now.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Broca, next time something like this happens, remind me to bring more food.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: You... whatever.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Man, this is boring, though. All this land forever and no way to use it.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Look, over here, we could set up a garage THIIIIIIIIS big, and then we could pimp rides inside. Wouldn't that rule?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: And what about Catastrophes? We'd have no way to stand up to one.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Egh. Catastrophes, Oripathy—nothing's ever good in this whole stretch of world.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Broca, I'm begging you, you got ANYTHING interesting?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Want to take a look?
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: What's this?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: A book I just finished reading.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: About what?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: A novel about a pair of lovers who were broken apart in the end due to the conflict between their two families.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: The ending is very moving.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Forget it. Whaddaya even doing bringing that kinda book?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Because Aosta said the journey would be incredibly boring.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Yo, Broca, I've been pretty curious for a while now. You like reading those?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Not 'like' like. I just read them when I have nothing else to do. They're alright.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: I gotcha. Yo, that reminds me, Aosta, you ever get a girlfriend before?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: You, Broca?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Pfft. Me neither. I don't get what's so fun about dating.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Hey, Aosta, I'm guessing you like that kinda book too?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: I prefer political and historical titles more.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Tch, I shouldn'ta asked. Those two words make me fall asleep.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: '♪She played mouth harp in a Victorian band,'
'♪But she fell in love with a Columbian man.'
Yo, can something just happen already—huh?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Hey, Aosta, look over there.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: That's...
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: I'm begging you, my mother's growing old and my children need me...
attributes.name: Merchant

attributes.content: Outta my face. I'm feeding my old and my young just the same.
attributes.name: Bandit Leader

attributes.content: Now be nice and shut up. You piss me off and I'll open you a few new breathing holes!
attributes.name: Bandit Leader

attributes.content: *whimper*...
attributes.name: Merchant

attributes.content: Hey, Aosta, Broca, I've got an idea.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Don't tell me you wanna play robbers with them.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Eh? I'm saying we scare the robbers the hell outta here, and then we ask these merchant guys for some supplies. How about it?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Yo, but your idea's not bad either.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: No. Actually, let's go with your plan.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: For sure?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: For sure.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: And if they don't cough up the goods, we just have to make them.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: I like it! C'mon, full speed ahead, let's knock those morons into next week! Broca, get ready to fight!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Hey, look over there!
attributes.name: Bandit A

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Bandit Leader

attributes.content: Ha! Get down!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Hmph!
attributes.name: Bandit B

attributes.content: Tch.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: (Whisper) I'll give you an opportunity. You take it...
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: (Whisper) Got it, got it.
attributes.name: Merchant

attributes.content: Also, Broca, you...
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Alright. I'll do my best.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: What're you mumbling about over there!?
attributes.name: Bandit A

attributes.content: Out!
attributes.name: Bandit Leader

attributes.content: Tch. You're a pretty tough guy. All of you, over here! Deal with him!
attributes.name: Bandit Leader

attributes.content: Got it!
attributes.name: Bandit C

attributes.content: Hmph!
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Hey, pretty boy, where you going!?
attributes.name: Bandit B

attributes.content: Now!
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Right, right!
attributes.name: Merchant

attributes.content: With Aosta acting as bait, the bandits have momentarily overlooked the merchants' presence, and on Aosta's signal to seize this chance, they jump aboard the car.
After that, following a fit of rumbling, the car vanishes into the dirt and dust.
Cazzo, you three sons of bitches!!!
attributes.name: Bandit Leader

attributes.content: Wait, what about our supplies now?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Just stay alive!
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: As the merchants draw the bandits' attention, Aosta jumps aboard the gang's own ride and revs the engine up.
Chiave, get on!
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Yeah!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Without waiting for Chiave's response, Aosta first drives the car straight into the throng of bandits.
But Chiave's known how things roll for forever now, and after dodging two guys, he grabs onto the door handle while the ride's still accelerating, and clambers aboard.
You're not getting away!
attributes.name: Bandit A

attributes.content: Broca!
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Here!
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Broca brandishes a drill bit out of nowhere at the bandits to push them off, and the moment the car passes him, Aosta putting pedal to the metal, he turns and jumps inside.
Hold on tight!
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Tch! Don't let 'em get away!
attributes.name: Bandit Leader

attributes.content: The bandits attempt to stop the three's car, but stopping a vehicle that's already going ain't easy. Their ride breaks out of the bandits' encirclement without a hitch, and races towards the horizon.
What are you doing staring at them?! You, you, and you, pursue the merchants! The rest of you, after those three assholes!
attributes.name: Bandit Leader

attributes.content: They WILL die in this wasteland today, you hear me!?
attributes.name: Bandit Leader

attributes.content: Got it!
attributes.name: Bandits

attributes.content: Whoaaaa, Aosta, look, they're catching up to us!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: I know! Fasten your seatbelts, I'm shifting this thing up!
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: '♪Con las manos arriba, cintura sola'
'♪Da media vuelta y sacude duro'
'♪No te quites ahora, que esto solo empieza'
Even as Aosta takes it to the redline, the bandits bite ever closer at their heels.
These jokers just don't give up, ha—*cough* *cough*.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Chiave, don't stick your head out at them. Close the window.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: What—did—you—say? I can't hear you over the wind!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Broca, pull him back in.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: *cough* *cough* *hack* *cough*—What the hell are you doing?!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Aosta told you not to stick your head out.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Chiave, what's wrong? What's the coughing for?
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: I don't know. Probably caught too much wind in my mouth?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Hopefully that's it.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: I have good news and bad news. Which do you wanna hear?
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Bad news first.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: We're almost out of fuel.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Ha. What's the good news, then?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: The good news is, it looks like we can shake them off before we run empty.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Whoa, I can see the wall of a nomadic city from here!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Yep, that should be Locomotiva City now.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Yo, doesn't look half bad. It's got more style than old Vite—*cough* *cough*.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Seriously, Chiave, are you okay?
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: I'm okay, I'm okay.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Then you're gonna help push the car with us. It looks real close, but if that's where we're going, we're not gonna make it today.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: The car's out of fuel, c'mon. What are we still doing with it? It's gonna be faster just to walk.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: There's actually still just a little fuel left. I'm leaving it for either when we get close, or when they catch up to us.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Also, this is the most valuable thing we have right now. Are you seriously gonna go into a city with empty pockets and try to make a living?
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: (Whistle) Fine.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Even as his face says he couldn't care less, Chiave still wanders over to one corner of the car, and starts pushing it with the other two.
Hey, Aosta, I can turn the stereo on for some tunes, right? Not like it'll waste much fuel.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: ...You can have that.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Awwrighty, ha, lemme see—let's put this one on now!
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: '♪Hello, brightness, my old friend'
'♪I've come to talk with you again'
—Tch, this song doesn't get me pumped at all.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: I think it's pretty nice to listen to.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Same here.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Fine, you both like it anyway. This works.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Yo, say, Aosta, you remember how we met each other, right.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Hm? Yeah.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: You were still a mechanic at the time, and then you beat the shit out of my family's people. I got sent in to clean you up.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Ha, and then us two fought, and then we were best friends forever.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: *cough* *cough* *cough*.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Hey.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: I'm fine. Broca? You still remember?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Of course. I'll never forget. You two saved me.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Ha ha, damn right. You really were a goddamn lunk, getting sold out by your family without even realizing.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: But rest assured. I'll never deal you away.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: ...Thinking about it, we really have known each other for a while now.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Sure have—*cough* *cough*.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Chiave, I'm vetoing you. Just rest in the car, no acting strong. Me and Broca can push just fine.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Hmph. I'm not acting strong.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Broca, I think we both got Oripathy together, right?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: I don't know.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: I think probably not. You just got examined at roughly the same time.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Broca's should be from that time with the fire, where someone gashed him with that Originium thing.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: And as for you, you never normally protect yourself against anything. I wouldn't be surprised no matter when you got it.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: *cough* *cough* Aosta, you spend the whole time with us, and you're gonna get it too one day.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: But even if I do, something tells me it won't be that bad.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Eh? Why's that?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: It'll be better than me watching you two suffer.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Ha ha ha, now that's my good brother right there.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: You've been talking endless crap today. Just lie down inside and relax yourself.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Aosta, I've decided what's going top of the list of things I hate.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: It's Oripathy.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Broca, carry Chiave into the car.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Broca, taciturn the whole journey through, goes over as he's told and picks Chiave up in his arms, putting him into the car's back seat, before moving right back to his original position and continuing to push the car.
As Chiave lies on the back seat, he's dazzled by the sunlight, and he brings up his arm to shield his eyes.
Heh. We got this disease, and that asshole Layton threw us out like we were disposable 'cause of it.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Hated me to the point it got hard to even breathe.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Aosta, the day we become heads of the Thirteen Families, I'm gonna find some way of settling this Oripathy thing, once and for all.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Mm-hm. When the time comes, we'll get a whole taskforce of doctors just to research the disease. Or maybe those real mighty hospitals. Give them some cash and get them studying.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Ha, damn right. And then I'm gonna set up this whole big hospital. Gonna find every single guy the world hated 'cause of their disease, and I'm gonna throw 'em all in there and cure 'em.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: And I'll clean up every single person who hated 'em.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: I'll help you out.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Ha, of course you gotta. Aosta, you too. Don't forget, you two are my consigliere and underboss.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Mm. Chiave, you'd best stop talking now. Just rest nice and easy.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Hey, Aosta.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: What do you think about dying out here on the barrens?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: What are you talking about.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Weren't you gonna be head of the Thirteen Families? What the hell are you dying in a place like this for.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Ha, yeah.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: But I thought about it kinda carefully just now. And nothing seems too bad about just dying here in the barrens, really.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: All the big cheeses are gonna go in the ground someday. What's the difference between death in a wasteland and death on a bed that cost a couple million, huh?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Find a couple stones, dig a hole, lie them down in it, and then close their eyes.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Pow—one person's dead.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Not so bad hearing it out loud, right.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Hold on, Chiave, what the hell are you saying?!
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: I'm saying, the sky today—cazzo, it's so blue—
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: '♪Seppellire in terra sconfinata.'
'♪O bella ciao, bella ciao, bella—'
Perhaps it was the battery that exhausted itself, as with little fanfare at all, the car stereo's music comes to a halt.
Chiave? Chiave?!
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: What the hell are you dying in a place like this for?!
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Broca, get in. I need to find some kind of rest stop somewhere. Hopefully I'll find someone...
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Zzz... zzz...
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Aosta, he just fell asleep.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: Goddamn you.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: But... we still can't be hopeful about Chiave's illness. Our best option remains to find an Infected doctor who's willing to treat him...
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Hey, you look like you've got car problems. Do you need some help?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Here, three portions of sashimi.
attributes.name: Jaye

attributes.content: Ha ha, about time.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Thanks.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: So, when you and the others got rescued by Rhodes Island, Chiave, that was when you joined them?
attributes.name: Jaye

attributes.content: Not at all. That operator, codenamed Straightedge, brought us all the way to the Rhodes Island office in Locomotiva, and then asked the medical operator stationed there to give Chiave some treatment.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Eyo, Jaye, you've got some real skill.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Much appreciated. See, I always thought that was how you joined Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Jaye

attributes.content: How? We didn't know them from Adam yet, and besides, Aosta gave the car over in exchange for the medicine. At the time, I actually thought Rhodes Island was pretty lousy.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: Haha.
attributes.name: Jaye

attributes.content: But Rhodes Island's medicine's pretty effective, right, Broca?
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: I can confirm.
attributes.name: Broca

attributes.content: As for why we joined Rhodes Island, to put it simply, it's because Chiave offended one of the big family heads in Locomotiva, and we had people out for our blood again.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: That time, Straightedge saved us again.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: And then, under his referral, we just straight-up came to Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: Got it.
attributes.name: Jaye

attributes.content: Heh. For the record, Aosta, that one was never my fault.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Aosta

attributes.content: It sounds like another new story all of its own.
attributes.name: Jaye

attributes.content: Heh, you got time, Jaye, brother? I'll tell it to you, in all its glory.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: It's already past midnight, and there's no missions tomorrow. I'll go get some Lungmen wine. We can drink and talk.
attributes.name: Jaye

attributes.content: Ha, now that's a plan.
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: That evening, me and Aosta were gonna go see...
attributes.name: Chiave

attributes.content: The men share their stories on into the dead of night in the empty cafeteria...
